reviewText: Fermi's twisty turny path...\nFermi's path is another in the ever expanding genre of reaction test" games. I like to call them youtube fodder
date: they're great when you scale up the difficulty and are able to produce reality bending feats of skill for the video replays
recommended:
but in general they play to a pretty limited audience. The question is - is this one going to be specifically any better than say Super Hexagon (one of the biggest names in this area) or the more brutal Velocibox?

The problem of good graphics.
The game -looks- pretty
hoursPlayed: with graphics running at a smooth clip
voteText: with a smooth palette of colours and vivid backgrounds
helpfulPercent: there's an almost ephemeral quality to proceedings as you glide along the "rail" towards your goal
votesFunny: and you've the ability to rotate in ninety degree increments along the rail
commentsCount: as well as jump and shoot certain types of obstacle to remove them. Herein lies both the biggest twist in Fermi's path
column16: and the major step towards originality in this area
column17: and the problems which in turn
column18: prevent it from escaping the shadow of games like Velocibox and Super Hexagon.\n\nWhen you twist and turn
column20: they pretty... don't look at the light! (I can't help it
column21: it's so beaaautiful...)\nThe problem with Fermi's Path
column24: but it's the kind of problem that will be a problem
column25: for anyone who intends to play at speed
column26: is that due to the nature of the game (rotating around a central rail) and the graphical nature of the game
column27: with lots of different colours and effects going on
column28: considering this is intended as a reaction game
column30: and at times the rail will obscure the obstacles and route coming up by virtue of the fact the route will be on the *opposite side of the rail* or off by ninety degrees. At low speeds this is quite easy to cope with
column31: but as the game ramps up into twitch territory
column32: this quickly dips into unforgivable sin territory.\n\nPlaying a twitch game where you do not have perfect information about what's coming up in the not too dim and distant is the cardinal sin of the twitch game world. In "The path mode" you have the ability to memorise the route by rote
column35: but ultimately lacking...\nAs a diversion from the more hardcore twitch games
column36: it certainly fills a hole. It has great graphics
column37: and as a way to unwind from the tougher games or even as a way to "warm up" before a session of Velocibox
column38: I could definitely see it serving a role. However
column39: as a twitch game in it's own right

column42: there's simply better options on the table. This is good
column43: but there is better.\n\nVerdict : Wishlist it
column44: worth considering if you're a big fan of twitch games and need a more sedate option to unwind with"

reviewText:
this game is.... not that great.
it's not terrible, but it's far from good as well.

------------------------------------


first of, let's talk about the positive stuff

you're a ball that follows a straight path, and you go to the end while avoiding various ennemies
the end.

the concept is simple and effective!
it's challenging and completing the levels feels like an accomplishement, which is great!


now you might be wondering:
but then

well here's why.



while the concept is simple and the game is challenging

so all in all

reviewText:
Beautiful game. Traveling through the quantem world, this game is a whole other world.
+Beautiful design
+Easy to learn
+Lots of secrets
+Hard, yet not punishing
+Don't even know what I am doing half the time
+Long
+Great music
+Level editor (Need to try it myself)
-There are no minuses (Wait, doesn't that create a paradox?)

reviewText:
Fermis' Path is small little fun arcadey racer game set in the world of the subatomic particles.

https://youtu.be/utxDIeGB-v8

Up until to a point that is...

The gameplay at first is very enjoyable and relaxing as you blast through beautiful sub atomic environments while collecting smaller particles then you and avoiding other particles that may cause a violent reaction.

You're movement is restricted to jumping and side stepping to the other sides of the quantum string(?) in which you are bound to along with the other particles.
Most of the particles are merely there as an obstacle rather then being violent towards you and so you can just jump or side step from harm's way.

Some of them though seem to find pleasure in taking a more radical approach to end you and either come speeding towards you or shoot at you with neutrons or whatever.
Fortunately though you have this ability as well and you may dispatch these particles while dodging the attacks they shoot.

The visuals and the music really help to set the mood for the game.
In the background there is a lot of weird quantum things floating around giving an eerie yet relaxing feeling.
The music also helps as it mildly futuristic in tone, even though I can't really nail down the genre for it, but I still find it to be fitting for the game.

Though the relaxing feeling for the game does change into frustration when you reach the tenth level or so.
Because at this point the games difficulty, just spikes up and doesn't seem to come down.
So do bear that in mind.

So if you were put of by the relaxing tones and thinking that this is just a filthy casual game, then fret not because there is a lot of challenge and replayability in the game as you try to perfect you're score and finding the secrets in the levels themselves.

There is also an level editor which I didn't really took a look at, but if you like making you're own levels then that's a nice bonus.

Do take look of some gameplay if you are interested in the video up above and below.

https://youtu.be/utxDIeGB-v8

reviewText: Runners usually please me, especially the science-themed ones like 'Boson X' or 'The Collider', but I don't recommend this game for it is unfairly hard and generally dull, plus it has blurry textures and lags on weaker machines. It's very difficult to assess right distances for your movement on that monotonous pathway you travel, there are no landmarks to judge it. Sometimes when the path bends you can't even see the upcoming obstacles, so you'll have to memorize the pre-made levels by heart. I shall hunt for achievements a bit, but I curse the devs already, Im so bored..\n\nБегунки обычно доставляют мне удовольствие, особенно научно-тематические типа Бозона Хэ" и "Сталкивателя"

reviewText:
Good game to load up for a casual play. It hits the spot if you don't have the time for a full-on game in your library.

The mechanic is fun. Graphics are good (although higher res would've made the experience perfect).

I got it in a sale but the £6 price isn't too bad for the amount of gameplay you'll get.
